title: Can we stop putting slows on every other spell?
body:
no, just because it has a small windup doesn't mean it needs to cripple you for landing it. Xin Zhao does not need an AOE line slow when he already has a dash (that I'm assuming still slows) and a knock-up, and an AOE knockback on his ult. 

Why are slows just the 'norm' and why do they get passed around like candy? This has been out of hand for years now; it's completely unneeded.

Extremes? This is based on what has already happened.

Zileans Q was given a stun. To compensate he got his scaling reduced from 1.1 ratio to .9 ratio. His base damage was also reduced, and the use of his W reducing his ultimate was taken away.

Mordekaiser has no self CC, and can 1v5 if he gets any kind of ahead and plays right.

Morgana has no slows and can Q bind for 3 seconds, ultimate and stun for..... what..... 2 seconds? And then bind again.

Ryze has 1 bind and no slows, and can spam his kit to deal obsurd damage if he is played well.... with a extreme form of mobility that even moves minions.

Those "extremes" are already in game. Most of the slows make sense with the abilities. Take away the slow and you could easily ruin the champion itself.... or it will just be replaced with something else. If no CC then it will become damage or sustain or both.
The tethers on Morgana's ult slow and the stun is 1.5 seconds

Chicken and the egg question: Was it because of the accessibility/availability of mobility being blown out of proportion that caused the CC creep, or was it the the growing accessibility/availability of CC that caused the mobility creep?

Whatever the case, they scale with and off each other and indefinitely, and it's kinda bad.
Having more CC in the game affects champs with low mobility way more than it does ones with high mobility, though
